@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+########################
+# OptaPlanner properties
+########################
+
+# The solver runs for 30 seconds. To run for 5 minutes use "5m" and for 2 hours use "2h".
+quarkus.optaplanner.solver.termination.spent-limit=20s
+
+# To change how many solvers to run in parallel
+# optaplanner.solver-manager.parallel-solver-count=4
+# To run increase CPU cores usage per solver
+# quarkus.optaplanner.solver.move-thread-count=2
+
+# To detect common bugs in your code
+# quarkus.optaplanner.solver.environment-mode=FULL_ASSERT
+
+# XML file for power tweaking, defaults to solverConfig.xml (directly under src/main/resources)
+# quarkus.optaplanner.solver-config-xml=org/.../timeTableSolverConfig.xml
+
+########################
+# Database properties
+########################
+
+# "jdbc:h2:mem" doesn't work in native mode, but native mode uses %prod properties
+quarkus.datasource.db-kind=h2
+quarkus.datasource.jdbc.url=jdbc:h2:mem:facility-location
+quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=drop-and-create

nodes.bodyText:
Something to think about: since we don't have any parent pom.xml for individual quickstarts, we define these versions separately for each one of them. The existing timetabling quickstart already declares quarkus version 1.5.2.Final.
(not in scope of this PR)

nodes.bodyText:
Yes. There's 2 viewpoints:

A) Define the quarkus/optaplanner version in a parent pom, to minimize our pain.
B )There is no parent pom, so the user can just copy paste the quickstart he/she wants to use, to minimize the user's pain.

quarkus-quickstarts minimizes the user's pain: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/blob/master/optaplanner-quickstart/pom.xml#L2

nodes.bodyText: default port 5005 vs. "EXPOSE 8080 5050" ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+####
+# This Dockerfile is used in order to build a container that runs the Quarkus application in JVM mode
+#
+# Before building the docker image run:
+#
+# mvn package
+#
+# Then, build the image with:
+#
+# docker build -f src/main/docker/Dockerfile.jvm -t optaplanner/facility-location-jvm .
+#
+# Then run the container using:
+#
+# docker run -i --rm -p 8080:8080 optaplanner/facility-location-jvm
+#
+# If you want to include the debug port into your docker image
+# you will have to expose the debug port (default 5005) like this :  EXPOSE 8080 5050

nodes.bodyText:
The docker file of all optaplanner quarkus quickstarts should be as identical as possible, I think.
They were copied from
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts
probably from the rest quickstart  or the hibernate-orm quickstart.
Upstream they might have changed already, and we want to follow such changes as we upgrade to a new quarkus version (but it's not part of our process yet...).
any issues in the docker files are probably worth discussion the quarkus zulip channel too: I would like to avoid deviating from their way only, except for rare cases that make sense.

nodes.bodyText: Is this some predefined user account in the UBI image?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+####
+# This Dockerfile is used in order to build a container that runs the Quarkus application in JVM mode
+#
+# Before building the docker image run:
+#
+# mvn package
+#
+# Then, build the image with:
+#
+# docker build -f src/main/docker/Dockerfile.jvm -t optaplanner/facility-location-jvm .
+#
+# Then run the container using:
+#
+# docker run -i --rm -p 8080:8080 optaplanner/facility-location-jvm
+#
+# If you want to include the debug port into your docker image
+# you will have to expose the debug port (default 5005) like this :  EXPOSE 8080 5050
+#
+# Then run the container using :
+#
+# docker run -i --rm -p 8080:8080 -p 5005:5005 -e JAVA_ENABLE_DEBUG="true" quarkus/code-with-quarkus-jvm
+#
+###
+FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi-minimal:8.1
+
+ARG JAVA_PACKAGE=java-11-openjdk-headless
+ARG RUN_JAVA_VERSION=1.3.8
+
+ENV LANG='en_US.UTF-8' LANGUAGE='en_US:en'
+
+# Install java and the run-java script
+# Also set up permissions for user `1001`
+RUN microdnf install curl ca-certificates ${JAVA_PACKAGE} \
+    && microdnf update \
+    && microdnf clean all \
+    && mkdir /deployments \
+    && chown 1001 /deployments \
+    && chmod "g+rwX" /deployments \
+    && chown 1001:root /deployments \
+    && curl https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/fabric8/run-java-sh/${RUN_JAVA_VERSION}/run-java-sh-${RUN_JAVA_VERSION}-sh.sh -o /deployments/run-java.sh \
+    && chown 1001 /deployments/run-java.sh \
+    && chmod 540 /deployments/run-java.sh \
+    && echo "securerandom.source=file:/dev/urandom" >> /etc/alternatives/jre/lib/security/java.security
+
+# Configure the JAVA_OPTIONS, you can add -XshowSettings:vm to also display the heap size.
+ENV JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dquarkus.http.host=0.0.0.0 -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.jboss.logmanager.LogManager"
+
+COPY target/lib/* /deployments/lib/
+COPY target/*-runner.jar /deployments/app.jar
+
+EXPOSE 8080
+USER 1001

nodes.bodyText:
I must admit that for the timetabling quickstart, I haven't tested the docker image build yet. Clearly, a lacking test.
Yet, we do want a req that all our quarkus quickstarts can easily generate a docker image...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+####
+# This Dockerfile is used in order to build a container that runs the Quarkus application in JVM mode
+#
+# Before building the docker image run:
+#
+# mvn package
+#
+# Then, build the image with:
+#
+# docker build -f src/main/docker/Dockerfile.jvm -t optaplanner/facility-location-jvm .
+#
+# Then run the container using:
+#
+# docker run -i --rm -p 8080:8080 optaplanner/facility-location-jvm
+#
+# If you want to include the debug port into your docker image
+# you will have to expose the debug port (default 5005) like this :  EXPOSE 8080 5050
+#
+# Then run the container using :
+#
+# docker run -i --rm -p 8080:8080 -p 5005:5005 -e JAVA_ENABLE_DEBUG="true" quarkus/code-with-quarkus-jvm
+#
+###
+FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi8/ubi-minimal:8.1
+
+ARG JAVA_PACKAGE=java-11-openjdk-headless
+ARG RUN_JAVA_VERSION=1.3.8
+
+ENV LANG='en_US.UTF-8' LANGUAGE='en_US:en'
+
+# Install java and the run-java script
+# Also set up permissions for user `1001`
+RUN microdnf install curl ca-certificates ${JAVA_PACKAGE} \
+    && microdnf update \
+    && microdnf clean all \
+    && mkdir /deployments \
+    && chown 1001 /deployments \
+    && chmod "g+rwX" /deployments \
+    && chown 1001:root /deployments \
+    && curl https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/fabric8/run-java-sh/${RUN_JAVA_VERSION}/run-java-sh-${RUN_JAVA_VERSION}-sh.sh -o /deployments/run-java.sh \
+    && chown 1001 /deployments/run-java.sh \
+    && chmod 540 /deployments/run-java.sh \
+    && echo "securerandom.source=file:/dev/urandom" >> /etc/alternatives/jre/lib/security/java.security
+
+# Configure the JAVA_OPTIONS, you can add -XshowSettings:vm to also display the heap size.
+ENV JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dquarkus.http.host=0.0.0.0 -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.jboss.logmanager.LogManager"
+
+COPY target/lib/* /deployments/lib/
+COPY target/*-runner.jar /deployments/app.jar
+
+EXPOSE 8080
+USER 1001

nodes.bodyText: Missing copyright?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+package org.acme.facilitylocation.bootstrap;

nodes.bodyText:
quickstarts shouldn't have copyrights. It's pain for users to want to copy-paste the quickstart and get going.
quarkus and spring boot quickstarts don't have those either: but they do have a license file in the root (like we do), to wave liability etc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+package org.acme.facilitylocation.bootstrap;

nodes.bodyText: Should be rather penalizeConfigurableLong?

soft suggestion on order:
define quarkus-resteasy* before optaplanner-quarkus* because in a demo when building the app, the funcionality order typically goes: first rest (resteasy), then database (hibernate, not applicable here), then AI (optaplanner).

nodes.bodyText:
Seems to do the same thing as DemoDataGenerator in the timetabling example.
We should try to use the same naming then

the fact that internally it does it in a very different way (not filling a database, but a in memory store), is irrelevant for the name consistency I think: we want users to easily switch between examples.
Remove license header in quickstarts
